intro: Koanophyllon peninsulare, commonly known as the Florida sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes or scrub habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white in color. Koanophyllon peninsulare is adapted to harsh, sunny environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
